conversation.content:
You are playing game where you are buying or selling an object. There is only one object for sale/purcahse.

Player RED is going to sell one object. Player BLUE gives ZUP to buy resources.

RULES:

```
1. You must always respond with:

    A) Propose a trade with (you can only trade in integer amounts, not decimals):
    <player answer> PROPOSAL </player answer>
    <newly proposed trade> Player RED Gives X: amount, ...| Player BLUE Gives ZUP: amount </newly proposed trade>

    B) Accept the trade by saying:
    <player answer> ACCEPT </player answer>
    <newly proposed trade> NONE </newly proposed trade>

    C) Reject and end the game:
    <player answer> REJECT </player answer>
    <newly proposed trade> NONE </newly proposed trade>

    Note: The game will end if one of the players ACCEPT OR REJECT. This means that you have to be careful about both accepting, rejecting and proposing a trade.

2. You are allowed at most 4 proposals of your own to complete the game, after which you can only reply with ACCEPT or REJECT.
DO NOT propose a new trade after 4 proposals. Your limit for proposals is 4.

3. You can reason step by step on why you are A) proposing, B) rejecting and C) accepting a trade with:

<reason> [add reasoning] </reason> add as much text as you want

This information will not be sent to the other player. It is just for you to keep track of your reasoning.

4. At each turn send messages to each other by using the following format:

<message>your message here</message>

You can decide if you want disclose your resources, goals, cost and willingness to pay in the message.
```

Here is what you have access to:
```
Object that is being bought/sold: X
<my resources> X: 1 </my resources>
<my goals> Sell resources for <ZUP>. It costed X: 40 ZUP to produce the resources </my goals>,
```

All the responses you send should contain the following and in this order:

```
<proposal count> [add here (inclusive of current)] </proposal count>
<my resources> [add here] </my resources>
<my goals> [add here] </my goals>
<reason> [add here] </reason>
<player answer> [add here] </player answer>
<newly proposed trade> [add here] </newly proposed trade>
<message> [add here] </message
```

Please be sure to include all.
You are Player RED.

<proposal count> 1 </proposal count>
<my resources> X: 1 </my resources>
<my goals> Sell resources for ZUP. It costed X: 40 ZUP to produce the resources </my goals>
<reason> As Player RED, my goal is to sell my resource (X) for ZUP. Since it cost me 40 ZUP to produce, I would like to start by proposing a trade that allows me to at least break even. I will start with a slightly higher proposal to leave room for negotiation. </reason>
<player answer> PROPOSAL </player answer>
<newly proposed trade> Player RED Gives X: 1 | Player BLUE Gives ZUP: 50 </newly proposed trade>
<message> Hello Player BLUE, I would like to propose a trade where I give you 1 unit of X in exchange for 50 ZUP. This price includes the production cost plus a modest profit margin. Looking forward to your counteroffer. </message>

<other player message> Thank you for the offer, Player RED. I value your production efforts, but I'd like to propose a counteroffer of 40 ZUP for 1 unit of X. This price still respects your costs and provides a fair profit margin, while also being more aligned with my budget. I hope we can find a middle ground that works for both of us. </other player message>
<other player answer> PROPOSAL </other player answer>
<other player proposed trade> Player RED Gives X: 1 | Player BLUE Gives ZUP: 40 </other player proposed trade>

<proposal count> 2 </proposal count>
<my resources> X: 1 </my resources>
<my goals> Sell resources for ZUP. It costed X: 40 ZUP to produce the resources </my goals>
<reason> Player BLUE has made a counteroffer that matches my production costs, but does not account for any profit. As the goal is to sell for more than the cost, I will counter with a price that is lower than my initial ask but still above my production costs. This should be a more acceptable middle ground that provides me with a profit while also considering Player BLUE's budget constraints. </reason>
<player answer> PROPOSAL </player answer>
<newly proposed trade> Player RED Gives X: 1 | Player BLUE Gives ZUP: 45 </newly proposed trade>
<message> I appreciate your offer and understand your budget concerns. However, I need to account for a profit margin as well. How about we settle at 45 ZUP for 1 unit of X? This allows me to cover my costs and make a small profit, while still being mindful of your budget. I believe this is a fair compromise. </message>

<other player message> I see your point, Player RED, and I want to respect your need for profit. How about we meet a bit closer to my last offer? I propose 43 ZUP for 1 unit of X. This should cover your costs and allow for a profit, while also taking into account my budget constraints. I hope this offer seems reasonable to you. </other player message>
<other player answer> PROPOSAL </other player answer>
<other player proposed trade> Player RED Gives X: 1 | Player BLUE Gives ZUP: 43 </other player proposed trade>

<proposal count> 3 </proposal count>
<my resources> X: 1 </my resources>
<my goals> Sell resources for ZUP. It costed X: 40 ZUP to produce the resources </my goals>
<reason> Player BLUE has offered a price that is slightly above my production costs, which does provide a profit, albeit smaller than previously desired. Given that this negotiation is about finding a middle ground that satisfies both parties, their offer is close to the price I last proposed. Accepting this offer would allow me to achieve my goal of making a profit, although smaller than intended, while also respecting the buying party's constraints. </reason>
<player answer> ACCEPT </player answer>
<newly proposed trade> NONE </newly proposed trade>
<message> Thank you for your understanding and willingness to negotiate, Player BLUE. Your offer of 43 ZUP for 1 unit of X is acceptable to me. It provides a reasonable profit and respects both our positions. I accept this trade. </message>

This information will not be sent to the other player. It is just for you to keep track of your reasoning.

4. At each turn send messages to each other by using the following format:

<message>your message here</message>

You can decide if you want disclose your resources, goals, cost and willingness to pay in the message.
